page.title: 15Housing - Broxwood Area
page.content:
There are very few recently built houses in this area. Buildings are fairly scattered and blend into the landscape. As the farming population has declined, many houses have changed hands, and are now rented or owned by people from outside the area.
Most of the larger buildings are farmhouses and are owner-occupied. Some are old timber framed dwellings, with examples of cruck beams.The 19th century estate houses in Broxwood are of red brick in an attractive style common to them all. The original farmworkers cottages are of stone or brick, and a few older ones are timber framed
Near Broxwood is an interesting house which was brought by road from Moor Court, near Lyonshall.
